intro: Bonnaya marginata, commonly known as the marginated bonnaya, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Acanthaceae and is characterized by its striking, showy flowers that are typically pink or purple. The plant features opposite, ovate leaves with a distinctive wavy margin, giving it its common name. It thrives in well-drained soil and prefers full sun to partial shade. Bonnaya marginata is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and as a houseplant.
